p: The M4LS extract of A. porophyllum yielded eight fractions with significant antifungal activity ( p < 0.05) against the three fungi under study. The fractions with the highest percentage of inhibition were F2 (34.9%) against P. clavispora, F4 (12.2%) against C. gloeosporioides and F5 (16.1%) against L. pseudotheobromae ( Table 4). Hexanedioic acid, bis (2-ethylhexyl) ester was identified in these three fractions, with percentages of abundance of 84.99%, 91.34% and 100%, respectively ( Figure 2).
